meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by a tendency to relapse into a previous condition or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her recidivistic behavior showed her tendency to keep going back to her old habits.
meanings.sent2: The recidivistic nature of his actions made it hard for him to break free from his past.
meanings.sent3: Despite his efforts, his recidivistic behavior towards sweets always led him back to the candy store.
meanings.sent4: The recidivistic pull of nostalgia kept her returning to the familiar streets of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The recidivistic pattern of his actions was like a never-ending cycle, always bringing him back to where he started.

meanings.definition: Involving repeated or habitual relapse into criminal behavior.
meanings.sent1: The recidivistic criminal was known for constantly returning to his unlawful activities.
meanings.sent2: His recidivistic tendencies landed him back in jail shortly after his release.
meanings.sent3: The recidivistic thief couldn't resist the temptation of the shiny objects in the store.
meanings.sent4: The recidivistic nature of his crimes painted a bleak picture of his future.
meanings.sent5: The recidivistic behavior of the gang members kept the police on high alert in the neighborhood.
